title: Script-like font
content:
Hello.

I am in search of the following font. I thought it's something like roundhand or bickham script but the '1' looks totally different.

[http://typophile.com/files/1000thskyinterior.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317161012/http:/typophile.com/files/1000thskyinterior.jpg "http://typophile.com/files/1000thskyinterior.jpg")

I guess the SKY INTERIOR font is pretty obvious and schould be Arial.

Thanks a lot and best regards,  
Chris

Font: 

 Berthold Boulevard 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317161012/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [1000thskyinterior.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317161012/http:/typophile.com/files/1000thskyinterior.jpg) | 29.32 KB |
author: detaildude

comments.content: "SKY INTERIOR" could be Arial and "100th" looks like **[Boulevard](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317161012/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Berthold&ffam=Boulevard%20-%20Italic&fid=40cc52c501e1b48fb8f4011a7c6e8893&fsize=60&text=100th&fit=1)** by Günter Gerhard Lange [1955, available from Berthold]

Thanks fvilanakis Boulevard seems to perfect.

I was searching all different kind of script fonts from Coronet, Maestro to Zapf Humanist and didn't even stumble across Boulevard.

Best regards.
